Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> We are searching to contract a developer to contribute in packaging Hush-NG for release. Duke has been working on finding someone for binaries, but progress has been slow. Hush-NG is in the very end stages, we just need to acquire the right talent to help it fully get there in a timely fashion. It is being worked on.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <obul312> If everything goes right and community contributes actively ..on a rough scale when can we expect it to be released

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <obul312> The price is already down more than 90% ..it's high time to speed things a bit ..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Unfortunately it's really hard to gauge for me, not being a coder and not knowing the extent of the packaging process. If the community wishes to help us in locating a binary packager, it would be greatly appreciated. We've had a hard time recruiting anyone from the KMD team to help out.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <gilardh> I contacted the former developer who created the official ad on bitcointalk (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2008578.0). It is OK to update his 1st post. Once this page in English updated we could contact the other members who created the ads in other languages ‚Äã‚Äãso that they update their post too.
What could help us is to get back in touch with these members and see if they are OK to update their post.
Chinese - Thanks to poiseulle
Czech - Thanks to TheTrunK
French - Thanks to Ratatackeur
German - Thanks to jedigeiss
Indonesian - Thanks to rozee
Polish - Thanks to Heimer
Russian - Thanks to fq, frHUxP * joE
Turkish - Thanks to Cean

If we can not get in touch with them (some have not logged in to the Bitcointalk site for over 1 year). It will certainly remove their links visible on the page https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2008578.0

If they are OK, we can translate the ad, create the new graphics with the translated texts, insert them on github and finally give them the code to insert in their post to update their page.

A large part of this work requires no knowledge of development.
